snippet: Women serve as mayors in 6 percent of Mexico’s towns and cities. By contrast, women hold one in four seats in Congress.
abstract: Women serve as mayors in 6 percent of Mexico’s towns and cities; by contrast, women hold one in four seats in Congress; political analysts who work with aspiring female politicians in Mexico say that the democratic process at the municipal level remains mired in a conservative and patriarchal culture, vague and unenforced gender quotas, and a lack of transparency and accountability.
lead_paragraph: Women serve as mayors in 6 percent of Mexico’s towns and cities. By contrast, women hold one in four seats in Congress.

headline.seo: In Mexico, a Scarcity of Female Mayors
headline.main: City Hall Still a Reach for Women in Mexico
headline.print_headline: City Hall Still a Reach For Women In Mexico
